entities.name: PALESTINE
entities.description: Residents may be subject to certain tax, exchange control or foreign asset/account reporting requirements under applicable laws as a result of the acquisition, holding or transfer of shares of Common Stock or cash resulting from participation in the Plan.

entities.name: POLAND
entities.description: Poland has exchange control regulations where funds in excess of €15,000 (or PLN 15,000 if connected with business activity) must be transferred via a bank account held at a bank in Poland. Documents connected with any foreign exchange transactions must be stored for five years.

entities.name: RUSSIA
entities.description: Acceptance of Restricted Stock Units results in an agreement governed by the laws of the State of Delaware, USA. The shares of Common Stock acquired pursuant to the Plan have not and will not be registered in Russia.

entities.name: NATIONAL BANK OF POLAND
entities.description: Requires reports on transactions and balances of foreign accounts if the aggregate value of shares of Common Stock and/or cash held exceeds PLN 7 million.

entities.name: RUSSIAN CENTRAL BANK
entities.description: Issued Directive N 5371-U which affects repatriation requirements for accounts with foreign banks in jurisdictions that have an international agreement on the automatic exchange of information with Russia or foreign brokerage accounts opened with financial market institutions other than banks.

relationships.relationship_description: National Bank of Poland requires reports on transactions and balances of foreign accounts for Poland residents under certain conditions.
Russian Central Bank issued Directive N 5371-U which affects repatriation requirements for Russia residents.
